container-title: It died out before 1805, and the New York Typographical Society, then a tradesunion, succeeded it in 1809. Philadelphia had a society in 1802, Washington in 1814, and Boston and Albany very early but
title: The Printer's Dictionary in 1852, and that again by the Printers' National Union, beginning in 1850. It is the oldest and one of the strongest tradesunions in America. A typographical society existed in New York in the year 1795, answering some of the purposes of a union, and in 1800 it prepared a scale of prices
